Restaurant Manager Job at De Palm Food Cafe




        
    

        
        De Palm Food Cafe is a duly registered food service company with a head office in Abuja. They deal in both indoor and outdoor services with local and continental dishes.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Qualifications
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	 Educational Qualifications: Minimum of National Diploma (ND) or Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, Catering & Hotel Management, Food Science, or related field.
	Added Advantage: Certificate or training in Customer Service, Food Safety, Hygiene, or Restaurant Operations.


Work Experience:


	 2–3 years of experience in a restaurant, hotel, or food service environment.
	Experience in supervising kitchen staff, cashiers, or waiters is highly preferred.
	Proven record of managing daily operations, inventory, and customer satisfaction.


 Core Managerial Skills:


	 Leadership skills: Ability to lead, motivate, and supervise staff.
	 Customer service skills: Friendly, patient, and professional with customers.
	 Organizational skills: Efficient in scheduling staff, handling orders, and maintaining records.
	 Decision-making skills: Quick to solve operational problems and handle emergencies.
	Time management: Ensures timely service and smooth daily operations.
	 Communication skills: Clear and respectful communication with both staff and customers.


 Technical / Business Skills:


	 Basic accounting and record-keeping (sales, expenses, daily reports).
	 Knowledge of food safety and hygiene standards.
	 Inventory management (stocking, reordering, avoiding wastage).
	 POS (Point of Sale) system operation and daily sales balancing.
	 Ability to prepare simple reports using Excel or notebooks.


Personal Qualities:


	 Neat, organized, and smart in appearance.
	 Honest and trustworthy — especially with money and supplies.
	 Friendly and approachable with customers.
	 Calm under pressure and solution-oriented.
	 Flexible — willing to work on weekends or public holidays when necessary.


Bonus Advantage:


	 Experience in marketing or social media promotion for the eatery.
	 Ability to train and monitor new staff.
	 Good knowledge of menu planning and customer preferences.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: depalmfoodcafe@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

	Strong understanding of 3D printing processes, tolerances, and materials (PLA, ABS, resin, PETG, etc.).
	Experience with design for manufacturing (DFM) principles.
	Familiarity with file export for 3D printing (STL/OBJ/3MF), mesh repair, and slicer workflow.
	Excellent attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and ability to work independently.
	Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.


Benefits


	Competitive contract rate, commensurate with experience and scope of work.

3D CAD Designer Job at Sproxil




        
    

        
        Sproxil is a global brand protection & consumer engagement solutions provider specialized in the provision of cutting edge advanced technology to combat counterfeiting, product theft and adulterations; as well as providing a platform for consumer engagement.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: 3D CAD Designer

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled 3D CAD Designer with extensive experience in designing mechanical casings and assemblies for electronic devices.
	The ideal candidate will be proficient in SolidWorks or Fusion 360 or TinkerCad, capable of creating precise, functional, and manufacture designs optimized for 3D printing, injection molding, or other fabrication methods.
	The contractor will work closely with our product and engineering teams to transform concepts and electronic schematics into production-ready enclosures that meet technical, aesthetic, and usability requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, model, and optimize 3D mechanical casings for electronic devices, including housings, snap-fits, and mounting features.
	Develop assemblies ensuring proper fit for PCBs, batteries, connectors, and other components.
	Prepare 3D-print-ready files (STL/OBJ/3MF) and support structures for prototyping.
	Collaborate with engineers to ensure clearance, tolerance, and accessibility for components.
	Conduct design reviews and iterate quickly based on feedback.
	Ensure designs adhere to manufacturing constraints, including 3D printing,injection or molding.
	Maintain organized libraries of CAD files, version history, and documentation.


Requirements
Qualifications:


	5+ years of professional experience in mechanical CAD design for consumer electronics, IoT devices, or similar products.
	Expert proficiency in SolidWorks and/or Fusion 360 (parametric design, assemblies, sheet metal, surface modeling).
	Proven experience designing electronic device casings, including enclosures for PCBs, connectors, and batteries.
	Strong understanding of 3D printing processes, tolerances, and materials (PLA, ABS, resin, PETG, etc.).
	Experience with design for manufacturing (DFM) principles.
	Familiarity with file export for 3D printing (STL/OBJ/3MF), mesh repair, and slicer workflow.
	Excellent attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and ability to work independently.
	Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.


Benefits


	Competitive contract rate, commensurate with experience and scope of work.

title: Job Openings at First Excelsia Professional Services Limited
content:
First Excelsia Professional Services Limited is a firm of highly versatile and renowned Human Resources, Organisational Development and Management consultants with a team of over a hundred employees spread across Nigeria. We have an in-depth understanding of the Nigerian business terrain and we are very passionate about partnering with indigenous organisations to develop glocalised HR solutions, processes and structures required to develop and effectively drive our clients' corporate strategies.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Project Manager

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Infrastructure / Telecommunications
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	Our client is seeking an experienced Project Manager to join its team.
	The role holder will ensure that all projects are implemented efficiently and to the satisfaction of the customer, and profitability of the organisation.


Responsibilities


	Plan, implement, and oversee telecoms projects to ensure delivery on-time, within scope, and within budget.
	Develop detailed project plans, allocate resources, and track deliverables.
	Coordinate internal teams, external vendors, and stakeholders for seamless execution.
	Perform risk management to minimize project risks and manage change effectively.
	Measure performance and prepare regular progress reports for management and stakeholders.
	Maintain strong client and vendor relationships, ensuring smooth communication and issue resolution.
	Prepare and maintain comprehensive project documentation.


Person Specification


	Bachelor’s Degree in Project Management, Business Administration, Engineering, or related field.
	4–6 years of proven working experience as a project administrator, manager, or team-member preferably on telecommunications, information technology or construction projects.
	Solid technical background, with understanding or hands-on experience in infrastructure rollout, construction or related endeavours. • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office with special penchant for project management, word-processing and spreadsheet applications.
	Experience in strategic planning, risk management and/or change management. • Good working interpretation knowledge of engineering and engineering drawings.
	Project Management certification (PMP, PRINCE2, or equivalent) is required.


Salary
N3,600,000 Annually (Net)

Application Closing Date: 22nd October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CVs to: talentsearch@firstexcelsia.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Senior Electrical Engineer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Energy

Job Description


	The Senior Electrical Engineer will oversee project teams, ensuring compliance with engineering standards, managing project timelines and budgets.
	The role holder will also act as a technical advisor and represent the client in professional settings, including client meetings, industry conferences, and regulatory engagements.


Role Responsibilities


	Develop and lead the design of complex power systems (e.g., renewable energy systems, grid integration, and power distribution networks)
	Review and validate engineering drawings, calculations, and specifications for grid-connected and off-grid systems.
	Ensure electrical designs comply with engineering regulatory standards
	Oversee project planning, scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation.
	Monitor project progress to timely delivery.
	Identify risks and implement mitigation strategies throughout the project lifecycle.
	Manage multidisciplinary engineering teams, offering guidance and mentorship to junior staff.
	Review team outputs, promote knowledge sharing, and enforce engineering best practices.
	Foster a collaborative, safety-conscious project environment
	Coordinate with contractors, consultants, and cross-functional teams to align execution.


Person Specifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering from a reputable university.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in managing complex power projects.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and engineering software (e.g., AutoCAD, ETAP, MATLAB, or similar).
	COREN certification is mandatory.
	Experience with renewable energy is highly recommended.
	Strong knowledge of power system design, load analysis, and energy efficiency optimization.
	Detail-oriented, self-starter, and able to work independently.
	Trustworthy, organized, and proficient in written and verbal communication.
	Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Application Closing Date: 28th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should email their CVs to: talentsearch@firstexcelsia.com with the title “Senior Electrical Engineer” as the subject.

 

 

3.) Litigation Lawyer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Law

Job Description


	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in litigation practice and courtroom advocacy, with a proven track record of handling complex cases.


Job Responsibilities


	Handle litigation matters across various jurisdictions
	Conduct courtroom advocacy, including trials, hearings, and appeals
	Provide expert advice on litigation strategy and risk management
	Collaborate with clients, colleagues, and other stakeholders to resolve disputes
	Manage and prioritize multiple cases, ensuring timely and efficient resolution
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients and stakeholders


Person Specification


	Bachelor’s Degree (LL.B.) in Law or a related field.
	5 - 8 years of post-qualification experience in litigation practice
	Strong track record of courtroom advocacy and litigation experience
	Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities
	Strong understanding of relevant laws and regulations.


Salary
N500,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 28th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to: talentsearch@firstexcelsia.com using “Litigation Lawyer” as the subject of the mail.

 

 

4.) Human Resource Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Telecommunications / Infrastructure

Job Summary


	The HR Officer is a detail-oriented, people-focused, and able to support organizational growth through effective HR operations and strategic initiatives.
	The ideal candidate will oversee key human resource functions including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, and HR compliance.


Responsibilities


	Sourcing, screening, and shortlisting candidates, as well as managing the onboarding process for new hires.
	Acting as the first point of contact for employee queries and grievances, and fostering a positive work culture.
	Tracking probation reviews, performance appraisals, and training needs, and supporting the implementation of KPI tracking and performance improvement plans.
	Ensuring compliance with labor laws and HR audit requirements, and maintaining HR reports and staff turnover data.
	Managing pensions and benefits administration, and delivering compensation and benefit comparison reports to the executive team, attendance tracking.
	Organizing staff training and monitoring staff performance and attendance.
	Looking after the health, safety, and welfare of all employees, and promoting equality within the company.


Person Specification


	B.Sc Degree in Human Resources or a related field
	4 - 6 years of experience in HR activities
	Proficient in MS office
	Professional Certification i.e., CIPM or its equivalent is preferred
	Strong understanding of labor laws and HR best practices
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Strong organizational and time-management abilities.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 22nd October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to: talentsearch@firstexcelsia.com using “Human Resources Officer” as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Openings at ICS Outsourcing
content:
ICS Outsourcing is Nigeria’s leading Outsourcing provider incorporated in August 1994. We offer a comprehensive range of outsourcing services ranging from People Outsourcing to Sales BPO. We provide bespoke Business Support Solutions to all kinds and sizes of business.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Advisory (DSA Supervisor)

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	A Pan African Consulting Firm is seeking a performance-driven Sales Advisor / Sales Field Supervisor to lead frontline sales activities in Lagos.
	The role is ideal for a motivated professional who can combine sales drive with field supervision and coaching to deliver growth


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and support field sales advisors to achieve individual and team targets.
	Develop and execute strategies to expand market coverage.
	Conduct regular coaching, performance reviews, and field visits.
	Track sales performance, generate reports, and ensure accuracy of field data.
	Enhance customer relationships, resolve issues, and drive satisfaction.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, or related fields
	Minimum of 5 years of sales experience, with at least 2 years in a supervisory role.
	Strong track record in achieving and surpassing sales targets.
	Excellent leadership, coaching, and customer engagement skills.
	Familiarity with CRM tools and field sales reporting systems.


Salary
N350,000 - N450,000 monthly.

Why Join Us?


	Be part of a dynamic Pan African consulting brand that values performance, innovation, and impact.


Application Closing Date: 24th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: molarinde@icsoutsourcing.com using the Job Position as subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Technical Services Engineer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Kitchen Appliances, Water Treatment & Renewable Energy

Job Summary


	Are you skilled in installing and maintaining household and professional appliances?
	Our client is looking for Technical Services Engineers to join their team.


Job Description


	Install, service, and maintain appliances (Ovens, Cookers, Refrigerators, Washing Machines, Ceiling Fans, Gas/Induction Hobs, Microwaves, Built-in Hoods, Coffee Machines, etc.)
	Troubleshoot and repair appliances, ensuring safety and customer satisfaction
	Deliver top-notch after-sales technical support.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree
	1-3 years’ hands-on experience in installation/servicing
	Strong troubleshooting & technical skills
	Valid driver’s license.


Salary
N300,000 - N400,000 / month (Attractive).

Application Closing Date: 30th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cudeh@icsoutsourcing.com using "Technical Services Engineer" as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Teller & Customer Service Officer

Job Locations: Abia, Akwa Ibom, Anambra, Bayelsa, Cross River, Delta, Ebonyi, Edo, Enugu, Imo, and Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Customer Service:
	
		Greeting customers and providing assistance with account inquiries and various transactions.
		Informing customers about bank products and services, and directing them to appropriate representatives for more complex needs.
		Building customer loyalty and ensuring customer satisfaction.
	
	
	Transaction Processing:
	
		Handling a wide range of financial transactions, including deposits, withdrawals, payments, and cheque processing.
		Processing foreign exchange, cash, and cheque transactions, including money transfers.
		Using banking software to track and record transaction information accurately.
	
	
	Cash Management & Reconciliation:
	
		Maintaining and balancing cash drawers, including packaging cash.
		Monitoring cash levels, requesting funds as needed, and performing cash analyses.
		Reconciling discrepancies and preparing daily "End of Day" sheets.
	
	
	Compliance & Security:
	
		Adhering to all bank financial, security, and operational regulations and procedures.
		Handling currency and confidential information responsibly.
		Identifying and resolving any transaction errors or discrepancies promptly and professionally.
	
	


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND qualification with 0 - 2 years of relevant work experience.


Key Skills & Qualities:


	Strong customer service and communication skills.
	High level of accuracy, efficiency, and attention to detail.
	Good mathematical and analytical skills.
	Proficiency in using banking software and tools.
	Ability to work effectively in a busy environment and manage workloads.
	Integrity and accountability in handling financial matters.


Salary
N112,000 - N120,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.
